greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(-x) * chi(x^5) in powers of x where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(1/4) * eta(q) * eta(q^10)^2 / eta(q^2) / eta(q^5) / eta(q^20) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (640 t)) = 2^(1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A145703.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x, x^2] QPochhammer[ -x^5, x^10], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 06 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^10 + A)^2 / eta(x^2 + A) / eta(x^5 + A) / eta(x^20 + A), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 17 2008
